intro: Purshia alba, commonly known as white gooseweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and strawberries, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Purshia alba is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
